content:
Many thanks for referring [redacted name] for urgent assessment following his recent deterioration. I reviewed him today accompanied by his wife and daughter.

As you know, [redacted name] was diagnosed with epithelioid glioblastoma in January 2024 following presentation with progressive headaches and left-sided weakness. Initial MRI showed a 4.8cm right parietal mass with significant surrounding edema. He underwent subtotal resection on 15th January 2024, achieving approximately 80% debulking according to post-operative imaging. Molecular analysis confirmed BRAF V600E mutation and TERT promoter mutation, though IDH status remains pending.

He completed a 6-week course of concurrent chemoradiation with temozolomide in March 2024, but unfortunately developed significant fatigue and grade 3 thrombocytopenia requiring platelet transfusion support. His maintenance temozolomide was commenced at a reduced dose of 150mg/m2 in April 2024.

Unfortunately, his most recent MRI from 15th May 2024 shows concerning evidence of leptomeningeal disease with new enhancing nodules in the posterior fossa and cervical spine. His left-sided weakness has significantly worsened (power now 3/5 in left upper and lower limbs compared to 4+/5 previously), and he has developed new onset diplopia. His performance status has declined from ECOG 1 to ECOG 3.

On examination today, he is alert but disorientated to time. There is obvious left-sided facial droop and diplopia on left lateral gaze. Power is reduced to 3/5 in both left limbs with increased tone and brisk reflexes. Truncal ataxia is evident on sitting.

Given the molecular profile showing BRAF V600E mutation, I have discussed his case with our molecular oncology team. We propose commencing combination BRAF/MEK inhibition with dabrafenib and trametinib. I have explained that while this is not standard therapy, there is emerging evidence for efficacy in BRAF-mutant glioblastoma with leptomeningeal spread. The main side effects including pyrexia, fatigue, and skin toxicity have been discussed.

I have arranged urgent MRI brain and spine with CSF sampling next week. We will commence dexamethasone 4mg QDS with PPI cover, and I have referred him to our neuro-rehabilitation team for urgent assessment. I will review him again next week with the results and to initiate targeted therapy if appropriate.
?
?
Please contact our acute oncology service if there is any acute deterioration in the meantime.
